suggestions: Discuss with your doctor to investigate the cause of your elevated MCH, potentially including vitamin B12 or folate levels.
Consult your physician promptly to evaluate kidney function and hydration status given the high Urea level.
Ensure adequate fluid intake unless advised otherwise by your doctor.
Schedule an appointment with your doctor to investigate the cause of your low Hematocrit and potential anemia.
Your doctor may recommend further tests to determine the type and cause of anemia.
